meanings.sent1: She continued to walk around asymptomatically even though she was feeling unwell.
meanings.sent2: The virus can spread asymptomatically, making it hard to detect.
meanings.sent3: The detective searched the crime scene asymptomatically, missing the crucial evidence.
meanings.sent4: Time passed asymptomatically, like a silent thief in the night.
meanings.sent5: The danger of the situation only became clear when he realized he had been acting asymptomatically.

meanings.definition: In a way that does not exhibit symptoms
meanings.sent1: The disease can be transmitted asymptomatically from person to person.
meanings.sent2: Even though she felt fine, she was carrying the virus asymptomatically.
meanings.sent3: The cat stealthily prowled around the house asymptomatically, pretending to be innocent.
meanings.sent4: His emotions bubbled beneath the surface, hidden asymptomatically from the world.
meanings.sent5: The truth remained hidden, lurking asymptomatically in the shadows.
